caption: Food and service was good, music was out ou touch and loud.
Great experience service was excellent food was superb 😁

Great dinner tonight. Nicely spaced indoor dinning—clean and safe. Veal was melt in your mouth good! As was the risotto, the ziti and the meatball appetizer.  Awesome staff—27 years in business and it shows.
The desserts and the foods were very delicious.

Loud tacky music overwhelms average food.  Staff ignored customer request to tone down the volume, one turned it down, one turned it back up.  DON'T go here.  Owner must be clueless about staff misbehavior.
An overall good experience. Service-8 Food-8 Ambiance-8
Top tier food with great service and attention, food and apps way above par, with a fantastic selection of deserts. We’ll be back!!
Fantastic service, even better food

I really can’t say enough good things about this place. I first went here probably 15 years ago and was blown away. I’ve gone several times since then, but it had been a few years. I went back yesterday and it more than lived up to how good it was in my head. The food was the best I’ve ever had and I’ve worked in high end Italian restaurants, the service was top notch and the prices are very reasonable and worth every penny. There are a lot of great places to eat in the north end and this place remains my number 1.
Had reservations at 745 and didn’t get seated until 845, then we waited another 30 minutes just for our server. The waiter and owner were friendly though.
Great spot! Super clean, awesome food, top notch service!!

Friendly and attentive staff. Food came out quick and it was delicious. Everything we ordered for the group was perfect.  Only issues was the lack of top shelf vodka and our server wreaked of cigarettes. Short of that, nice experience.
Food and service was excellent. Nice quaint Italian restaurant. Definitely will go back
Excellent food and service with good prices. It's also a block away from Hanover St. and not so crowded!
Very friendly and knowledgeable wait staff! Everything was cooked to perfection and the wine list was comprehensive without being overwhelming.
Fun, friendly, great veal chop.  Easier than trying to eat on Hanover

when we first got there it was all good the owner was really nice so was the waitress, she was quite good asked us for drinks then our food. when the food came out it was disgusting, chicken parm was horrible and cold like they had the food sitting there, the salmon with broccoli was also nasty it tasted burnt, cold and had no seasoning also OVER PRICED, I would never complain about prices if food is good but it wasn’t worth it at all, when i got the bill I paid gave the waitress tip she literally ran back before we left and demanded me to give her extra tip once she seen that I gave her exactly what she deserved and she charged me $40 for a $7 sangria... smh never again I would give them negative stars if I could
Excellent service.  Had the rack of lamb with risotto and it was delicious.  Great cocktails.
Food was pretty good. They were not socially distancing for COVID. I sat outside, while the inside was packed to capacity
Amazing food, great service and staff. Risotto was amazing!

The set-up outside due to covid was done well - I think the staff did a great job taking care of guests while adhering to the rules for dining. The food was wonderful! We had the chicken parm, penne pink, meatballs and Caesar salad. If you're a fan of penne ala vodka, the Penne Pink is a MUST for you - as it's made with mascarpone and was absolutely delightful!
Great drinks & bartender service.

We found this place while looking for somewhere to hold our family party of 7  and it was great. Service was top notch, food was delicious and prices were reasonable. There were 2 other large family parties in there while we there and they were locals so we felt like we definitely made a good choice. They made us feel at home.
Delicious food and excellent service, was great for a night out with the family
Exceptional service and amazing Italian food.  You can't go wrong ever!
Great experience and great food.

Food pretty horrendous. Restaurant was 60 degrees and everyone in restaurant was wearing their jacket. Calamari was great to start but the linguini with shrimp along with the linguini with clams were certainly not fresh pasta and were very disappointing. Good service, but the food didn't make up for it.
Amazing food, and service!
No service at all ! We got only water ! BRAVO
Excellent service, good food and the limoncello martini - delicious.
Very nice meals ..
Great authentic Italian restaurant near Paul Revere house!  Very accommodating of our diet needs.  Friendly!   Short walk from the Marriott and the aquarium.
(Translated by Google) Excellent atmosphere, cuisine and services in a unique neighborhood in Boston  (Original) Excelente ambientacion, gastronomía y servicios en un barrio unico en Boston
Veal Marsala's the best I've had

It took over an hour for our food to arrive after ordering. And once it did arrive it was oversalted. The atmosphere was nice, and in a good location. The food that was properly prepared was enjoyable.

We absolutely loved this authentic Italian gem of a restaurant in the North End right near the Paul Revere house.  We only came for desert but the lemon sorbet in the lemon peel and the cannoli were very fresh and delicious. Highly recommended!

Friends and I decided to have dinner the Saturday night of The Fishermans Feast. It did not disappoint. From the moment we got there till we left everything was great from the service to the food and drinks.Servers were very knowledgeable of the menu.The Host Mike couldn't have been more congenial. Myself and my friends who are all of Sicilian descent look for one important thing when we eat Sicilian or Italian.Does the sauce remind us of home and yes it did.I plan on making Riccardos a once a month stop if not more frequently. Also the specialty drinks from the bar were great.

Highly recommend! 😀 Four of us sat at the bar on a Thursday evening around 9pm. Aldo, our bartender was excellent. We had the special app of stuffed meatballs, which was so good! We had seafood, lasagna, risotto & pasta. Everything was delicious! Would have posted photos, but we ate everything 😋 Molto bene!
Great traditional menu. Classic atmosphere. Excellent quality.
Great food, great service
We went at this restaurant on June 15 2019 with a organize trip from Quebec, Canada. The service and the food was excellent! Thank you I recommanded 👍
Got sick from food had chicken
Amazing food and service.
Great service and great food.  Been there before and will return again.
The food was fresh and delicious. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu!
Authentic food & amazing service. If you’re looking for a top Italian restaurant in the north end of Boston, I can only warm-hearted recommend this one.

Took an hour to get our food (which was overpriced and not that great), charged us for water, and just an overall poor experience. Went to another spot in the old north end last night and the quality was night and day between there and here. If you are going to go to the old north end, go somewhere else. Would not come back here again
Ordered the Scallops and shrimp linguine. At first bite seemed a little chewy but thought nothing of it. Head home and proceed to have the worst food poisoning of my life.
The best meatballs ever

I come here once a season; My Dear Heart and I wandered here on our first time out and just had dessert. Now, we return for the service, the amazing dinner, and the dessert. This place is a classic and should be on your list.
Lovely food and amazing service
Great Italian food at great prices.

Riccardo's Ristorante has great service and rustic Italian food that is delicious and fresh. Located across from The Paul Revere House on North Street in Boston's historic North End. The menu includes traditional red sauce dishes, home made pastas and seafood and grilled red meat. Something for everyone and a nice variety of wine and cordials to compliment the meal.
Excellent food and service.  Riccardo is a generous host.
Best place in North Boston! Food was amazing.  Service was fantastic. The owner is a great honest guy.  Only giving 5 stars because I can't give them 10.
Good food. Great service.
Fantastic service and food. Our bartender Jenna was outstanding
Good food. I do not reccomend the espresso martini.
Nice beginning to our 25th anniversary celebration. Food good and service great.
Excellent food. Excellent service.

We took a group of 40 people there from long island. These guys rocked.  They got all of the students served with in an hour.  Food was great. Staff was the best part of the night. We will be back in the spring.

We got there about 40 minutes before our reservation and they were happy to seat us which was great. We ordered wine bruschetta and entrees. All came out super fast and on-top of each other which wasn't great. My Shiraz tasted as if it had been there a couple of days and was only offered more at the end of our meal. The place got really busy quick so we are not sure if they were just trying to turn the tables over. Our food was ok at best bruschetta was drowning in balsamic vinegar and pasta dishes lacked flavour and hard shell clams were bitter. I would like to chalk it up to they were busy since they were. But there are so many other Italian restaurants in the area I will try a different one next time.

09/02/18  Over priced  *Sunday dinner--rest. basically empty. One of us Ordered chicken dish $24.00 & waiter asked: Ziti or linguine? When bill came we asked about the ziti charge & he said oh! that's extra.What?? $24.00 for chicken only..& he did NOT mention that! Totally over priced. My son had the lasagna--Good Also had the chicken parm w/ziti --Sauce was acid(y).. Can get same food just as good or better on Hanover St. for much LESS. Drinks --HIGH Overall I would say: Skip this place...One waiter...Rug dirty...Bathroom  falling apart.
Amazing food! And the remove shrimp shell off of the tail
Always a great meal at a reasonable price at Riccardo's. Off Hanover so you can usually get a table as well

Great place to eat.  Staff is excellent, very knowledgeable and friendly.  I love how they don't need to write down your order, and they get it right every time.  It's a little more expensive than it has to be.  But it's quickly becoming one of my favorite places in the north end.

The host was very accommodating.  We were told we would have a table by the window on a Friday night when we did not have a reservation.  Everyone was very kind to us, attentive but we did not feel rushed.  The food was very good and the portions were large.  We had an appetizer, entree and dessert and were very full when we left.  This was my first time in Boston and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Owner was very rude and lurking. Waiter rushed us to order.  There was literally no one else and no need for this treatment. $17 for 4 small pieces of shrimp. The water glass was not clean. Can't find any positives on my visit.
It is good food but we found hair on one of the shrimp and we got 10% of our bills from the manager.
Excellent
Great food. Good atmosphere.
Positively delicious!  Best value for money in the North End!

Food was mediocre. Had the veal special and clams & linguine. Nothing special about the special and over priced, for taste and presentation. Caesar salad was decent but the dressing was very concentrated and not spread out well throughout. Calamari was average at best. Service was not to par with pricing and presentation. Sangria was probably the best part of the meal.
Food was good but service was slow.  Expensive.
Close to home made sauce in the north end
Friendly staff. Really loved the the lemonchilo shrimp appetizer.
Amazing service, Amazing food, and amazing location. The street is not too bust so it makes the experience more quaint. Food is perfectly cooked, great place for a date.

Waited 10 minutes just to get menus, despite asking the host who had them under the podium he was leaning on. Asked the waitress for the house red, and she almost brought us a $75 bottle of wine without revealing the price. Thankfully we asked. The food was mediocre and portions are small. Everything is ala carte. Almost chipped a tooth on the bread. Not recommended, choose somewhere else.
Food is excellent, layout is top tier, & the service is impeccable. Would highly recommend, especially if you're trying to dodge the chaos of Hanover St.

What a disappointment! 3 of us went for a traditional Italian dinner. We are NOT PEOPLE WHO EVER send dinners back. The shrimp was over cooked and rubbery, , almost unchewable. The seafood risotto had was dry, had an awful smell and could not be eaten. Upon compliant, we were told the two dinners that we could not eat would be removed from the bill. Only one was. We were there at  7pm and already they were out of Sea Bass. The bread was nothing special. The ambiance is pretty and the wait staff was nice, but the food was a disaster. Sadly, I cannot recommend.

Great service, jovial waitstaff, wonderful food, large portions, right in North Square across from iconic Paul Revere House. Try the zuppa riccardo and the rollatini di melanzane appetizer - just those two items are a whole meal. We love this restaurant.
Waiter was strange and basically told us not to order any of the things we wanted.

Great food and more reasonable prices than most of the restaurants along  Salem Street. Dishes are good size and flavorful and the specials are always excellent. One of our go to places in the North End.

Service was extremely slow (to put it nicely). Bread was cold and broccoli rabe was unseasoned. A little over priced though for what we got overall. Larger groups beware they throw tip on at the end. I will not be coming back here. There are many other better options around to go to that aren't so over priced as well as extremely slow
Average restaurant. Chicken parmigiana does not have enough cheese and tomatoe sauce is acid, not cooked enough time. They don't accept more than 4 credit cards/table. Service is good.

Came here for a Saturday lunch with two kids. Service was very accommodating, plenty of tables available. Fried calamari were fantastic, gnocchi were tender, peach Bellini delicious. Great experience!
Best Italian food I have ever had!!!!
Just an appetizer took 40min. Sorry way to long
Best Italian I've had in a long time! I still have dreams about the veal gnocchi...
This is the best place in the North End for authentic Italian food. It is unbelievably good. I highly recommend going to Riccardo's Ristorante.
Amazing food although the prices were a little bit expensive. The hand made pasta is delicious and we'll seasoned. I would recommend for a date.
No wait time for a party of 5. The restaurant was quiet enough for us to have conversation. The food came out very quickly and was DELICIOUS. Excellent. Highly recommend.

Last evening we dined at Richardo's.Probably in ten years we have dined there about 50 times.Superb service,friendly owners Richard and Richard Jr. We have dined so often I honestly feel like Im a guest at a cousin or neighbor or good friend.Genuine happy to see you greeting no matter how busy they are.Im a creature of habit I almost always have the Rissotto a la Richardo with shitake mushroom and spinach in a tasty smooth sauce.A bottle of great chardonnay a side of delicious bruchetta finished off with black coffee and Sambuca and of course the extraordinary terramisu and a unexpected please a pony of chocolate wine.Fifty meals fifty 5 star experiences.We also were served a two waitresses one from Algeria and the other from Rumania.Do I sound a little biased? I am as a retired concierge at the Seaport hotel I risked my reputation for reliability hundreds of times and everytime my guests returned to the hotel to tell me about the Ritz Carlton level service the quality of the food the comfortable ambiance and the genuine hospitality of the owners Richard Sr.and Jr.Richardo' has a 91% approval rating.91% If your a student at Harvard and you received a 91% academic rating your gonna have the Fortune 500 companies wining and dinning you to join their firm.You know where the recruiters take the best and brighest? Richardo's cmon thats a no brainer.Hope you enjoyed my review.Gerard Leary,Professor Umass Boston
Great place to eat

Food was superb!  My husband and I cleaned our plates.  Caesar salad and fettuccini Alfredo were so good.  Hubby had chicken Parm with pasta. He loved it!  Great cozy atmosphere,  the owner was very personable.   Enjoy!

I was part of a group of 7 guys. The waiter was very helpful and friendly, he made several excellent suggestions, the service was prompt, the food was fabulous and the price was right. We all had a great meal and the staff helped make it a fun night.

7 friends planned on a night out March 18th for some corned beef and cabbage.  Since Faneuil Hall was wall to wall, we changed directions to North End and ended up at Ricardo's.  The food was amazing and staff as good as it gets. Plan on returning soon.
The food was amazing and the staff was very attentive. The menu has a nice selection of classic Italian dishes. We had the "Pollo Exquisito" and the veal special of the day, they were both delicious.
Nice food and drink... Enjoyed myself

Riccardo's is a great place for dining, meeting up with friends and having a special event.  The atmosphere, the food, the service, the staff and the owners, all make it special.  I've been going there for years, and have always been pleased with everything!
My veal was just ok, my friend loved her spinach stuffed pork.  Service was good. Great ambiance!  I'll eat here  again for sure.
Amazing food
Great food but the most horrible service. The waiter was rude, sexiste and racist. I would not go back ever again
The waiters are invasive, sexist and don't know how to make math, to split fares and understand tips.  The food is not bad, but worse service in US.

Never been to Boston, enjoying the North End neighborhood, lots of busier restaurants for the tourists. This wonderful place was quiet and the atmosphere was relaxed and comfortable.  The service friendly and prompt.   Authentic dishes and a nice wine list. Lobster ravioli with shrimp was delicious.  If you are in Boston try this wonderful family restaurant.
Service was slow and veal was too tough.
Authentic Italian food
Great service! They really appreciated our business. The meatball appetizers were excellent. Try the veal.

Recently my wife and I had an opportunity to enjoy a wonderful dinner at Riccardo’s in Boston’s Little Italy.  From our seating thru dinner our service was friendly and prompt.  The menu included traditional Italian dishes, several with the Chef’s own twist.  My wife thoroughly enjoyed her gnocchi  and I also loved the Chicken Parm with pasta.  The red sauce was as good as any I’ve had in Italy.  The wine list was more than adequate and desserts were also well done.  We were able to meet the owner and the son who is the Chef.  Both were extremely friendly and interested in our thoughts of the food and the restaurant.  We would highly recommend Riccardo’s.  Four stars from us!
meh... better choices in the north end

Group of over over 12 people.  We asked to receive split checks before the food actually came out (although after we placed the orders), and waitress wouldn't do it, even though the place wasn't busy.  Staff subtly tries to rush us when it takes us a quite a while to figure out the bill.  That's what happens when you don't split the check guys.  Less than 5 minutes from your waitress would've saved 20+ minutes of us figuring out the bill.  This bill payment also would've been less difficult if they had not charged us for bottled water at over $4.00 per 12 oz bottle, that was left on the table at the start, and similar dirty charging for sparkling water.  We didn't ask for it, and if it's there at the start, I'd assume it to be complimentary.  Sleazy.  Food was mediocre as well.  Meatball appetizer was obviously microwaved, with still cold center.

Ok I think I am being very fair giving this place two stars. The food was not worthy of the price. The door staff sucked and would not seat us when there was plenty of table available. Once we were sat, we ordered pasta dishes because we wanted whole made pasta....I mean we are in the north end. Well needless to say this place uses store bought pasta and my Irish ex-girlfriend makes better gravy! To top things off there was some guy barking orders while sitting at the bar boozing! That is not the ambiance you want when you take your lady out in the north end! I hope this helps people decide whether to go to this place in the future.
Friendly enough people. Unfortunately, the food was mediocre and the service clumsy and uncoordinated.

The lasagna and chicken parmesan were absolutely awesome!  The service was great and everyone was very friendly.  It was a short walk from our hotel near Faneuil Hall.  I would recommend this place to everyone looking for good Italian food at a reasonable price.

Like other reviews have said, do not go here. 8 pm reservation, took 45 minutes to be seated. We did not get any food until 10pm. Other tables were getting up and leaving due to same issues. Wait staff checked on us once or twice during this time. We got a small bread basket for our group of 6, one tiny piece of bread each during this time, when we asked for more bread we were told they were out of bread. 5 minutes later,  another server takes a larger basket of bread to another table. We ask her for more bread and then get it. When the food did come it just was not good. Nobody in our party was happy with their food. I had pork, and it was very dry and tough. There generally seemed to be a bit of an attitude from the staff with their customers. I think maybe if the restaurant focused on the execution of the food and service, delivering a quality product and experience they would have happier customers and be able to lose the attitude.

It's saturday night, you are in North End with no reservation? DON'T GO THERE. You are near starvation and would eat anything, anywhere? DON'T GO THERE. You have an hypoglycemic girlfriend who's losing it? DON'T GO THERE.  I think you get it. This is a bad, bad place. Food is aweful, service is lame and it's a ripoff. Never had such a bad experience in my life. And I have seen shitholes.  That's what's up. Please don't go there.
The food tasted microwaved.

Our friends and us stumbled upon Riccardo's as a result of a tip from the pedi-cab that dropped us off in the middle of the Historic District. The restaurant across the street was full and laughed at us, at the idea that we should expect to just walk up and ask for a table on a busy night. We walked across the street to Riccardo's and were immediately given a table in the center of the restaurant with a great view of the busy street activities. The restaurant was charming and full of life. The food was some of the best Italian I have ever eaten. My Caesar Salad and Lasagna was to die for! Everyone at our table loved the food. We spoke in length with the owner of the restaurant and were impressed with his concern that we had a great dining experience. I will make an effort to seek out Riccardo's again on any return to Boston. I dream of his lasagna! Viva Riccardo's!

We try to eat fish whenever possible, for our health, but this is difficult in the North End. Riccardos, however, has a number of seafood entries and they are good. My Branzino with tomatoes and evoo was excellent. It came with a very light sauce, eggplant and broccoli rabe. My wife had a chicken risotto which she felt was the best risotto she had in a long time. The wine list was decent and the service very good, although we ate at lunch when the restaurant was fairly empty.

Riccardo’s is an old-school Italian restaurant that we picture visiting with family as a kid. The decor isn’t necessarily dated, but it seems to lack the charm of other “on-the-beaten path” restaurants and isn’t quite modern, either. That being said, the staff and patrons at Riccardo’s Ristorante were charming and friendly. What it might lack in perceived upgrades it truly makes up for with service and a warm and family atmosphere (think baby and wedding pictures on the walls, and the people in them are the ones greeting you at the door).
good food, a bit pricey. too bad they do not have a valet service.
